title: Ronnie Killen named Restaurateur of the Year
text:
Photo: Kimberly Park Image 1 of / 1 1 Ronnie Killen with Kelley Seeberger Louis at the 2015 Houston Culinary Awards presented by My Table magazine. Killen was named Restaurateur of the Year for his work at Killen's Steakhouse and Killen's Barbecue in Pearland.
Photo: Kimberly Park Ronnie Killen with Kelley Seeberger Louis at the 2015 Houston... Ronnie Killen named Restaurateur of the Year 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Houston's restaurant and bar community has always been something of a mutual support group. Local chefs and bartenders are tight and often act as their own best cheerleaders.
Nowhere was that more evident than at the 2015 Houston Culinary Awards presented by My Table magazine Sunday night at the Houstonian. The 19th annual awards ceremony that recognizes the city's top chefs and restaurants brought out some of Houston's brightest culinary stars. And they all cheered for each other as the 10 Houston Culinary Awards were handed out.
One of biggest ovations came for Ronnie Killen who was named Restaurateur of the Year for his work at his white tablecloth Killen's Steakhouse and his game-changing Killen's Barbecue , both in Pearland; and for Ryan Pera who was cited as Chef of the Year for Coltivare and Revival Market . The award for Best New Restaurant was given to Holley's Seafood Restaurant & Oyster Bar led by chef Mark Holley. And Pastry Chef of the Year went to Rebecca Masson who this year realized her dream of opening her first brick and mortar store, Fluff Bake Bar .
Midtown's Weights + Measures took home two of the top awards: Outstanding Bar Service and Best Interior Design. It also was named Favorite Late Night Spot in the Houston Foodie Star Awards, a separate round of awards voted on by My Table readers.
The evening also included a tribute to Donna and Tony Vallone who were presented with the Legends of Houston Restaurant Award, recognizing legendary restaurateurs and food professionals in Houston.
"It's an honor for us. It's thrilling. It feels like yesterday that I was a 20-year-old kid getting started," said Tony Vallone, who this year marked his 50th year in the restaurant business in Houston.
He praised the city's culinary community saying "we are a great food city -- we can hold ourselves with anything else in the country."
He drew laughs we he recounted his response to a customer who asked when he was going to retire from overseeing his restaurants including the luxurious Tony's . Not anytime soon, Vallone said: "I hope they carry me out with a fish in one hand and pasta in the other."
The evening was hosted by Teresa Byrne-Dodge, founder of My Table magazine. A portion of the proceeds will benefit the Grant Gordon Foundation.
The 2015 Houston Culinary Award winners:
Restaurateur of the Year: Ronnie Killen (Killen's Steakhouse, Killen's Barbecue)
Chef of the Year: Ryan Pera (Coltivare, Revival Market)
Up-and-Coming Chef of the Year : Terrence Gallivan and Seth Siegel-Gardner ( The Pass & Provisions )
Outstanding Wine Service : Underbelly
Pastry Chef of the Year: Rebecca Masson (Fluff Bake Bar)
Outstanding Bar Service: Weights + Measures
Service Person of the Year: Steven McDonald ( Pappas Bros. )
Houston Classic (restaurant in business for 10 years or longer): Backstreet Caf√©
Best Interior Design: Weights + Measures
Best New Restaurant: Holley's Seafood Restaurant & Oyster Bar
Houston Foodie Star Awards winners:
